messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] {{{Elissa}}}}
messages.msgSnippet: Read the same to me.  I thought it was about the same and how folks had played Telephone, Telegraph and what started out as xyz became zyx Lynda I
messages.messageBody:
Read the same to me. I thought it was about the same and how folks had
played "Telephone, Telegraph" and what started out as "xyz" became "zyx"
Lynda

I understand all that. I just felt very uncomfortable with my name repeating
over and over in an email, especially when alot of what was written seemed
attributed to me and was incorrect.
Why was it necessary to "sum it all up"?
~Elissa Cleaveland
"It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction
have
not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein

played "Telephone, Telegraph" and what started out as "xyz" became "zyx"

Lynda

From: "Julie Stauffer" <jnjstau@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, March 25, 2002 11:06 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] {{{Elissa}}}}


> Dear one,
>
> Breathe deeply and relax. My take on Koleen's post was that the "war" was
> basically a misunderstanding over a misunderstanding. That you handled
> yourself with aplomb(is that a word?) and that you had already apologized
> for any feelings you might have accidentally hurt so what were people
> fighting over?
>
> Or perhaps I misunderstood the entire post and Kolleen is just a big old
> meanie <g>.
> Julie

messages.subject: Re: lost posts

messages.messageBody:
Quite a few of my posts never showed up either. Including the one to
Elissa to encourage her to keep on posting.
Are they lost forever, or will they show up eventually?
Joanna

> kaydeecross wrote:
> >
> > Anyway, my cursive, answering, math and another post never made it
> > here. Oh well, there was some great reads on it!
> >
> Let's hope they make it. A number of my posts to various groups
> haven't shown up either - it's frustrating!


Some of the posts that I already read were pretty much what I posted.
So it doesn't matter. Sometimes, a lot of times, I don't answer if
someone posted something that I would of. I figure why duplicate the
same thought.

kolleen

messages.subject: Re: {{{Elissa}}}}
messages.msgSnippet: ... handled ... apologized ... people ... Yes Julie, thanks for the clarification. If this post makes it, I ll be pleasantly surprised. I ve posted 15 times on
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Julie Stauffer" <jnjstau@g...> wrote:
>My take on Koleen's post was that the "war" was
> basically a misunderstanding over a misunderstanding. That you
handled
> yourself with aplomb(is that a word?) and that you had already
apologized
> for any feelings you might have accidentally hurt so what were
people
> fighting over?


Yes Julie, thanks for the clarification.

If this post makes it, I'll be pleasantly surprised. I've posted 15
times on three different groups collectively in the past two days and
nothing has gone through. I've added a yahoo address to my account
and hoping this will do the trick since I'm still on the road.

It was originally a misunderstanding. And then it snowballed. And I
think the war was over a post that never existed. What a misagosh!!!

Anyway, my cursive, answering, math and another post never made it
here. Oh well, there was some great reads on it!

regards,
kolleen

messages.subject: {{{Elissa}}}}
messages.msgSnippet: Dear one, Breathe deeply and relax.  My take on Koleen s post was that the war was basically a misunderstanding over a misunderstanding.  That you handled
messages.messageBody:
Dear one,

Breathe deeply and relax. My take on Koleen's post was that the "war" was
basically a misunderstanding over a misunderstanding. That you handled
yourself with aplomb(is that a word?) and that you had already apologized
for any feelings you might have accidentally hurt so what were people
fighting over?

Or perhaps I misunderstood the entire post and Kolleen is just a big old
meanie <g>.
Julie
